result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J Schwab was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua J Schwab is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua J Schwab was found guilty of Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  Sentence credit of 1 day was granted.
May be transferred to Dane County.  Early release after two years if Agent deems appropriate.

miscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of probation.
Surcharge to be be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of illegal controlled substances. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Any valid prescriptions drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  Disclose to any physician in writing your drug history/dependency signed by your physician and provide a copy to your Agent.  Follow though with any treatment and/counseling recommended by Agent.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  Defendant ot pay surcharge.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
Huber with work and treatment, non-working hours with standard release conditions - To commence 1/8/2016 at 5:00 p.m..  Last 30 days are STAYED for use at Agent's discretion
AMENDED 1/6/2016:  COURT WILL STAY REPORT DATE TO 1/28/2016 AT 5:00 P.M.  REVIEW HEARING IS SET FOR 1/25/2016 AT 8:30 A.M.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua J Schwab and attorney Susan Blesener for Bruce J Rosen appeared by phone.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court will allow the work release jail term to be served in Dane County.  Judgment to be amended.
dated Jan 21, 2016 from Atty Bruce Rosen, filed with copy of letter from Sheriff of Dane County
Review hearing at 01-25-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Joshua J Schwab in court with attorney Bruce J Rosen.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for a motion to modify conditions of probation filed by Attorney Rosen.  Court makes statements.  Parties make statements.  Court denies the request to modify the conditions of probation.  Defendant may not serve his jail term on electronic monitoring.  Court will STAY the commencment of the jail term until 1/28/2016 @ 5:00 pm while Attorney Rosen explores the jail opportunities for his client.   Court adjourns this matter.  Court allows both the defendant and counsel to appear by phone.  Review hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.
